pr_title: feat: add support for tagging to Connection API

timeline.bodyText: How will this behave if the user never set a transaction tag?
timeline.author: thiagotnunes

replies.bodyText: It is nullable, so that is not a problem. It is verified by this test case.
replies.author: olavloite

timeline.bodyText: Out of curiosity, could we prevent the calling of this for a COMMIT? The user should not be able to do a statement tag in that case.
timeline.author: thiagotnunes

replies.bodyText: Good question. We can't prevent it before the COMMIT, but we can throw an exception if COMMIT is called after a statement tag has been set, and I think that makes sense as we are quite strict in checking the order of other statements (e.g. you are only allowed to get a commit timestamp if you actually committed etc.).
replies.author: olavloite
olavloite
